title: How to Build a Photography Lighting Reflector

steps.headline: Get a white sheet of paper, or gold or silver, depending on the type of light you want.
steps.description: Gold gives faces a very warm light, and silver gives it a more cold type of light. White just gives you harder light.

steps.headline: Lay the silver or gold film on the cardboard.
Tape it or staple it to the cardboard.
Go outside, or into a studio environment, whichever is available, with your subject and either shine the light onto the reflector and angle it so it hits your subject, or work with the ambient light.
steps.description: Adjust the focus and composition of your photo, and take your pictures.

text: Buy a large cardboard  Get a white sheet of paper, or gold or silver, depending on the type of light you want. Gold gives faces a very warm light, and silver gives it a more cold type of light. White just gives you harder light. Lay the silver or gold film on the cardboard.  Tape it or staple it to the cardboard.  Go outside, or into a studio environment, whichever is available, with your subject and either shine the light onto the reflector and angle it so it hits your subject, or work with the ambient light. Adjust the focus and composition of your photo, and take your pictures.
